Macro Definition Documentation

#define SON_ACCESS_MAX_USER_SIZE   (93)

Defines the maximum length of the user supplied values for the access parameter.

Function Documentation

int son_read_bool ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access 
)

Reads the value specified by access as a boolean.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base data type is not true or false, it will be converted to true (1) or false (0).

int son_read_data ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access,
void *  data,
son_size_t  size 
)

Reads the value specified by access as raw data (no type).

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
dataA pointer to the destination data
sizeThe number of bytes available at the destination
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base data type is not raw data, it will be interpreted as raw data without performing any conversions.

float son_read_float ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access 
)

Reads the value specified by access as a floating point value.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base value is not a floating point value, it will be converted to one if possible. SON_STRING is converted using atof() and SON_DATA cannot be converted (error will be set to SON_ERR_CANNOT_CONVERT and 0.0 will be returned).

s32 son_read_num ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access 
)

Reads the value specified by access as a signed integer.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base value is not a signed integer, it will be converted to one if possible. SON_STRING is converted using atoi() and SON_DATA cannot be converted (error will be set to SON_ERR_CANNOT_CONVERT and 0 will be returned).

int son_read_str ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access,
char *  str,
son_size_t  capacity 
)

Reads the value specified by access as a string value.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
strA pointer to the destination string
capacityThe max capacity of the destination string
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base value is not a string, it will be converted to a string.

u32 son_read_unum ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access 
)

Reads the value specified by access as a unsigned integer.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
Returns
Less than zero on an error

If the base value is not a unsigned integer, it will be converted to one if possible. SON_STRING is converted using atoi() and SON_DATA cannot be converted (error will be set to SON_ERR_CANNOT_CONVERT and 0 will be returned).

int son_seek ( son_t *  h,
const char *  access,
son_size_t *  size 
)

Seeks to the value specified by access and copies the size of the data.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
accessThe access string
sizeA pointer to the destination data size
Returns
Less than zero on an error

This function is useful if the size of the data is unknown when it needs to be read.

1 son_t s;
2 son_size_t size;
3 char * name;
4 son_open(&s, "/home/test.son");
5 
6 son_seek(&s, "person.name", &size);
7 name = malloc(size);
8 son_read_str(&s, "person.name", name, size);
